title: Tips and tricks for champs you play
body:

Anivia: if you run teleport, cast it right before you pop your passive. If the enemy can't interrupt the channel, it will channel through and you'll get out alive. Still not sure why they haven't bigfixed this but it works. Also, if against a Blitzcrank, you can summon your wall in the line of his hook and he won't be able to pull you through it, although to be fair I don't know if this still works, but at one time it did.

Morgana: Her pool is wide enough that you can take out an entire minion wave. Wait for the wave to settle, and than cast directly in the middle. Finding just the right spot is hard, but with practice you can eliminate entire waves without leaving stragglers.

Bard: This is less of a functionality trick and more of a playing tip, but I find it extremely helpful to map out my chime paths via pings. Before every game I tell people an example, and it alleviates a lot of the "wtf are you doing bard" moments. I do a plain ping on the chimes I'm going yo collect in order, and then an on my way pung back to my lane. Helps with communication a lot.

Katharina: Your ult is an amazing tool against people with invisibility. Especially against Akali, you can literally just ult on top of them and the kunai will still hit them, unlike some other auto targeting abilities.

{{champion:35}} You can use his clone (R) to dodge any ability if you time it well. This includes tower shots and Zed ult.

R loses tower aggro and make the clone take a turret shot, unless you damage an enemy (even with the clone) which will make the turret target you again.

You can easily solo drake at lvl 6 by juggling aggro between you, the clone and a box.

{{item:3053}}  and {{item:3156}} both work on the clone make it alot more durable plus trick unwary opponents thinking these passives only apply on the real shaco.

(also would give you couple of seconds before they realized you Q away and use their red trinket/pink ward)

{{champion:26}}  Your Q reveals the area within its blast radius, use it to check bushes or dragon/baron pit.
Your E slow is stronger than its speed up. (e.g. a 50% slow divides their speed by 2, but a 50% speed up only multiplies your speed by 1.5.)
At lvl 18 with max CDR your ult is on a 33 second cooldown. In other words, it will be up for basically every teamfight.
As support, don't fall into the trap of always maxing Q first. If your lane opponents don't have any dashes, maxing E can either get your carry out, or keep theirs still for a gank.

Spamming /laugh as Blood Lord Vladimir or /joke as Classic Vladimir is almost guaranteed to tilt your lane opponent.

Blitzcrank
His rocket grab is always firing his right hand, which makes the skillshot have a slight angle across his body; also only the hand part of the animation has the hitbox. Which means with patience & practice, you can pull someone from the opposite side of a moving minion wave. However the brief stun doesn't take effect until they're stationary in-front of him, so if your allies are close, be be prepared to use overdrive & power fist if they break his hold with a movement ability (such as flash, or ezreal's arcane shift). But be wary of when to use his overdrive, as the underdrive slows him after the boost, which can gimp an escape attempt. 

Darius
Is one of the few great anti-tank tanks (juggernaut is just a subset), he can rubble a tank in drawn-out brawls. Obviously his weakness is that he has no mobility ability to speak of. His short ranged apprehend doesn't deal damage, but interrupts other animations and can reach over a handful of walls in the rift. Due to his crippling strike having no scaling with rank, always max it last but take it before level 6; it can be used as an auto-attack reset to get a few quick stacks of hemorrhage. Like teemo, this built-in dot can mess up his farming if he's under pressure, so crippling strike or decimate could be used for farming with good mana management. Despite his sluggish steamroller playstyle, he seems oddly effective at fighting yasuo in a duel; though his shield blocks some of the bleed & guillotine, the fake ninja's dash lands him in the axe path of decimate, and doesn't deny his crippling strike either.

Nautilus 
His dredge line is similar to blitzcrank's rocket grab but with a few differences; it has a shorter but wider hitbox (for obvious reasons), can't go through terrain, and functions like a cross between blitzcrank's & amumu's grapples. Of the 4 hookshot style champions, he's the only one unable to grab across walls, but instead drags him to the wall he hits; meaning it's his only mobility ability, and not to be used lightly as it still has a noticeable cooldown. In most cases, it pulls him closer to the enemy champion than them to him (something about the center of hitboxes compared to relative mass), so if you nab someone, expect to go farther than halfway to them. And thanks to his sluggish attack speed, it's often best to wait a moment (.25~.5 seconds) to auto-attack after hooking someone in order to maximize the lockdown duration; however his grapple has the same weakness blitzcrank's has, so this forced delay isn't always a good idea. Titan's wrath gives his auto-attacks a dot & aoe, but won't reset his attacking animations either.

Tahm Kench
While not as imposing of a tank like the anchorman, he's just as effective at keeping an enemy pinned. If an assassin is trying to nuke your ally, eat the assassin; the assassin will outrun you if you try to save your teammate, this way you keep them from finishing their combo while they create more distance. This is particularly effective at denying buff reliant or time reliant ones (like master yi, nocturne, & tryndamere). However if they have extreme or spam-able mobility (katarina, ekko, leesin, ext) then this is probably stalling the inevitable without more teammates nearby. Note that at pointblank range, his tongue lash can be used as an auto-attack reset if he needs to devour the enemy immediately; but remember he can only eat one champion at a time, regardless if friend or foe so choose wisely depending on the situation. Also if they have some kind of continuous aoe effect, it will continue to apply around tahm too, so don't go walking into your team if you bite a spinning wukong.

Thresh 
Unlike blitzcrank & nautilus, his grapple is on a significant delay, slightly longer than a second; so don't rely on it if you're not good at predicting. While his sweeping flay isn't sluggish, the area is deceptively small (barely reaching beside him, but mostly in-front & behind), however it's important to know that it can interrupt movement abilities and bump them into the direction you clicked if you time it right. However his ultimate box will not, and though it says it has a 99% slow, there's a minimum movement speed cap; and due to the cast delay, don't expect it to save an ally from an assassin. The shielding lantern from dark passage has similar leashing to orianna's ball, it can only be sent a fair distance, but doesn't return until moved noticeably farther away; remember that it has a lengthy cooldown too, so decide carefully to use it for the damage absorption or saving yank. Something often overlooked is that thresh has laughably low base armor, so don't go thinking you're durable until late game, collecting with the lantern is something handy if you don't want to get close.

{{champion:8}} 

Do not use E in lane to farm against champions that have a gap closer; they will punish you with a full combo if you do it. If you have to E farm, make sure you step back right after so they can't counter-combo. 

There are a variation of builds but the main focus should be getting to 40-45% CDR as soon as possible through a combination of items, runes, and masteries. Max CDR Vladimir is a God because he will have an AOE nuke available for every team fight (his ultimate). CDR is important because you'll have your escape up more often (W), and you can spam your other abilities too. YOU HAVE NO MANA COSTS. Your health cost becomes completely negligible. 

I recommend going mid lane Vladimir (even though he's supposed to be Top) because you'll auto-win most of your match-ups simply by rushing Spirit Visage. 

Take Ghost and Stormraider's Surge for dramatically increased mobility in combat. If you kill the other mid laner or if the other laner leaves, you can look to Gank bot or top with a Ghost + Hemoplague attack. 

The pros do Rylais on him after getting close to 40% CDR, however, I recommend Deathcap for SoloQ for greater burst and higher AP ratios. Rylais assumes your team mates will follow up on your plays and not be fools; its better to have higher damage with Death Cap so you can solo burst targets if need be. Because you have Stormraiders; if you hit an ability on a squishy you will gain the movement speed boost to rush after them and finish them off. 

The main trick to fighting well with Vladimir in team fights is to aim the new E. Always fully charge it in team fights (this is contrast to laning where you want to be more careful). When charging your E, move right up to the target and try to be as close to the target as possible, moving in the same directions as you anticipate they will move. Your combo should be R on as many targets as possible to start (use Ghost to enter the fight if necessary); charge and fire E... follow up with Q, use E, Q and W in any order as it makes sense to do. You'll get a ton of health back when R pops. 

A useful trick for E is to charge E, Flash, and then pop it. 

Vlad fights as an AOE off-tank. He is "tanky" because of his slippery abilities (Spirit Visage and Zhonya is also usually core). He is the frontline but he also deals a ton of AOE damage and can carry games. 

...

Also, don't buy {{item:3152}}. I know the pros do it but its stats are very questionable and if you take Ghost and Stormraiders... you don't need it. Its generally better to do Visage into Zhonyas into Ionians into Rabadon... or Zhonyas into Visage into Ionians into Rabadon whichever order makes more sense based on match-up. If the enemy is magic heavy I'd switch out Zhonyas for Abyssal Sceptre but you should be careful about not having any amor at all.
